string.description: name of the NTPClient
resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash
the namespace scope in which to operate
Router used to reach the NTP servers.
the Kind of the router used to reach the NTP servers.

list.description: Selects router resources based on the defined KIND.  Applies to DefaultRouter only. Not supported for Router and ManagementRouter.

bool.description: Indicates whether this server should enable burst synchronization or not
Indicates whether this server should be preferred or not

string.description: An NTP server can either be an IP address or an FQDN

list_nested.description: A list of NTP servers, each entry in the list can either be an IP address or an FQDN.

string.description: Specifies a Interface resource to use as a source of NTP traffic. If none is specified the Node default behavior is used.
Specifies the source interface Kind to use as a source of NTP traffic.

single_nested.description: The NTP client allows for configuring NTP servers and the source of NTP traffic in order for the devices to synchronize their clocks.

int64.description: Indicates the health score of the NTPClient

string.description: Indicates the reason for the health score
The time when the state of the resource last changed
Reference to Node object
Operating System of the Node
Synchronized state of the Node

list_nested.description: List of nodes which are not synchronized

string.description: Operational state of the NTPClient

single_nested.description: NTPClientStatus defines the observed state of NTPClient

string.description: a comma-separated list of resource fields to fetch/return.  If unspecified, all fields are fetched.  If empty, only key-fields are fetched.
an EQL "where" expression that will be used to filter the set of resources returned.
a label selector string to filter the results based on CR labels
the namespace scope in which to operate
